author: frogstudio
title: Not the best
review: Just got this set today. My feelings towards it are mixed.  Though minifgs included are great (though there aren't hand weapons for the dwarf nor shields for none of the minifigs), the vehicle itself isn't a good design.  If I had the chance to go back in time, I wouldnt pay 7 pounds for it...  Sorry TLC, sometimes you nail it, sometines not.

author: merkalK
title: Cool figs, medicore vehicle
review:
Bought this set online since I didn't know when and if it comes to stores and didn't want to wait any longer to expend my new castle generation collection. 

Pro
* The figs are great, My first dwarf, the beard is clever and the evil orcs are amazing. 
* New sword and flag
*Catapult is clever with the pullback chain

Cons
* The spinning blade doesn't work because the wheel doesn't roll. 
* To simple design
* Poor dwarf is defenseless without handweapons. 

4 out of 5 stars

author: Rgijaba
title: why does everyone call the trolls "orcs"? ive never even heard of a orc...
review: besisdes, LEGO calls them trolls, so their trolls. now lets get reviewing! tthis set comes with: a dwarve warrior (shame he doesn't have his axe...), and two trolls, one with the scary troll flag, the other with a grey troll stone sword. now on the box the wagon looks more... impressive. but in real life, its hard not to look at it for some reason. now it has a simple but effective desine (spelled wrong. mabey ishould star using spell check?), but the only way to make the blades spin is if you push realy hard on it at you move in forward. whats even making it move? there are no horses or anything... and, being a fantasy era set, has great pieces! a graet set for your LEGo castle collection! but not the best...

author: Gus_263
title: OK set, but with some problems
review: This is a set of the castle theme, one of the newest, and this don't have a small size, but it isn't big. The set includes three minifigures, two trolls and a dwarf. The trolls looks like to be silly due to the color and face designs. Some details are good on the armor, but the helmet have a bad used metallic color, it hidden these details. The dwarf must be small to be a dwarf, and the legs are really short, but these cannot moves, is an unuseful piece . And another bad positioned thing is the beard, it is so long for the minifigure, and with it the helm don't fit very well, making the arms be the unic playable things on the minifigure. Altough the minifigures have each problems, the color scheme stay good, and these includes some itens, like the helmets of the trolls, the helm of the dwarf and the sword of a troll. The set also includes a flag from the trolls, well designed and positioned (it fit well in the sticks, altough the flag don't have the previous material, used in other sets). The building involved, in the "vehicle" (it is a catapult with wheels, and in the  same time it features spiked wheels on the front), is made using four wheels with a considerable size, and two long bricks on each side, connecting it to the plate used as a base. The two wheels on the front have a elastic connecting these to the spiked small wheels, and it don't moves well with it, but without, it is worst. The silver small spiked wheels on the front are bad positioned, one to each other, but it makes a good effect in the design. Above some brown colored bricks and plates, making the base, there is the dwarf, where it stay. The position is good for the mini figure, but the legs of the dwarf minifigure aren't playable, and it makes the position bad. Few blocks builted on the front of the dwarf's position are increasing it, and these makes another effect on the design, the dwarf looks like to be more protected. On the side of the dwarf, there is the catapult. It works well, and it is big, features some gold and brown schemes. The playability is good with the catapult, troll minifigures and wheels. The design of the set too still good, altough the trolls looks like to be silly and the dwarf isn't much playable (it only moves the arms, and these are so much big for him, but are in the normal lego shape). Overall, it still good, but the minifigures could be better, and the front of catapult don't shows a good building for current sets, but the price is considerable. In comparison with other sets of the same price, size and theme, it gets 4/5, good but can be better.

author: rEV300
title: cool for a small set
review:
this set is super cool.
pros-

comes with a small dwarf
the dwarfs legs are small
the blade thing works on carpet
the pull back catipult
three minifigscool trolls

cons-

the dwarf does not come with a weapon

author: greenfrog_7
title: Dwarves Mine Defender... mine
review: Not quite an enthusiastic "mine!" for this one, a rather disappointing set. I have many of the same comments as for the Troll Assault Wagon - it feels very minimal and I wish I could have some more pieces added on there to give it some weight and some decorative flare. It doesn't help that the spinning blades don't spin, disappointing after the number of interesting contraptions included in other sets which worked flawlessly.

author: Legonater
title: Gimlie's Mine Defender
review: I almost bought this set because of the Dwarf that looks like Gimlie, the Trolls that look like Orcs, and the Mine Defender that could be used for Mars Mission. Not at all for it's actuall use... But I decided to wait a couple weeks and buy the Jungle Cutter instead.

author: andy87
title: Great new set!
review:
I got it yestarday and am very glad they finally make cheaper sets with the trolls.

Pros:
3 minifigs
catipalt fires well
cool flag

Cons: One wheel doesn't turn
Dwarf has no playabilty


Over all a great set!

author: Lint
title: Great concept, unfortunately comes off very lean
review:
Pros
Saw blade pieces
Pull chain catapult
Trolls!
Banner!

Cons
Trolls lack weapons/shields
Saw blade mechanism function is mediocre
Dwarf has no hand held weapon/accessory

I love the troll banner. My biggest gripe is that the dwarf did no come with an axe. The pull chain catapult is surprisingly entertaining and I appreciated the tiltable frontal shield assembly on the vehicle. This set has its greatest value in providing 3 minifigs and awesome vehicle parts and a banner! However I feel it is lean on minifig accessories which could have made it one of the best sets in the line.

author: rabk295
title: Pretty good...
review: This set is pretty good. The dwarf is cool and the trolls are also very cool. I am very pleased with the helmets of both races. It is a cool idea to have the rotating blades, but I find that the wheels only rotate well if they're on a rug. Either they should have a tighter rubber band, or they just shouldn't have the blades. The one major problem for me was that the set didn't come with the silver sword it was supposed to, and even though they sent it for free, it was shipped all the way from Denmark. I do very much like the way you fire the catapult with a chain. That adds a bnit of a realistic, good lookng touch to the set. Overall, this set is worth buying and if you have 10 bucks that you don't know what to do with, buy this set.

author: asianlego
title: Halt! And prepare to be..
review:
.. disappointed. The trolls are again clones. The flag is cool. The vehicle looks quite ugly though. It looked like a combine harvester they use in fields to harvest grain. Also they shouldnt use a blue rubber band there because it makes the set looks very juniorized. I took apart the combine harvester and built a Dwarve's Mine Assault Wagon - a MOC out of it. I used the blades as wheel (three wheeler) and the four large round pieces as chassic support. All the brown, grey, chains and blades makes the MOC looks somehow steampunk-ish and aesthetically pleasing. (Picture in my MOCPages soon). If you are low on cash and want to get a decent-sized Castle set, this would be it. The dwarf is awesome! Reminds me of the dwarf Gimli from LOTR. 

-asianlego

author: SaintElsewhere
title: Meh
review: I literally JUST got this set less than an hour ago, and I had it together in five minutes. I now realize that perhaps I should have gotten the Troll Assault Wagon, even though it was more expensive. It's good if you're in it for the figs alone, and this works with Dwarves' Mine, but it's not too good on its own.

author: the_lead_general
title: trolls?    splat     Where?
review:
Dwarves mine defender

Plus+
     Two trolls with weapons, cool mine defender and well designed dwarf. The catapult comes with two chains which can be removed as it fires better that way, plus you have two spare chains. The mine defender goes great with the mine and acts as a body guard.

Minus-
      The troll flag breaks apart, the one in tower raid is better. The blades don't work very well, and the dwarf doesn't come with any weapons. It could come with another dwarf full armed. It is hard to get the dwarves beard off.

Equals=
       A reasonably cheep set to add to the playability of your castle.

Compatibility
             This set goes best with the dwarves mine. But it could go well with troll warrior.

author: HQuiff
title: A Nice Start!
review:
If you're looking to get your first Castle set I would highly recommend this to anybody. It's nice and cheap, and fun to build and use.

Pro(s):
 - Two really realistic goblins, and of course the dwarf 
 - The Trollâ„¢ flag
 - A small easy to use Dwarf Miner with fully working functions 
 - Handy additional weapons
 - A Catapult perfect when using your own creations 
Con(s):
 - The Mining spikes on the front of the Dwarf Miner only work on uneven surfaces.
 - Maybe if they added on a few Euro they could put in a small Barracks for the trolls.

Over all I would give it about a 4/5.
Hope this review helps.

HQuiff.

author: JSB23
title: Ewww.... Troll blood
review:
This is a pretty good little set I got it for my birthday a few months ago and I think it's a really fun set

Pros
Three Mini figs great for a 10 dollar set
Two rare chain pieces
Cool troll helmets
The blades are fun >:)

Cons 
Not enough weapons
The blades don't spin very well

Overall
Worth picking up if you see it

4/5

author: keexko
title: Castle Fantasy!
review:
This set is pretty good. It introduced two new races to the castle scene. 

My only wish was that there was an extra weapon for the dwarf and the other troll.

It is hard to make the troll stand due to the weight of the banner but, it is manageable (your troll wont be standing straight though). 

All in all 4/5

author: CrzyLCF
title: A great set for an army builder
review:
This is a pretty neat set which is a great addition to the Dwarves' Mine. It comes with a working catapult that has a nice firing method with two chains attached to it so you can pull it from the back, spinning blades, 2 troll warriors and the standard dwarf. Now let's go into more details.

Pros:

- finally, another way to fire the catapult than the standard way
- spinning blades to frighten away the orcs
- number of minifigs (just gets better doesn't it?)
- troll banner (always useful)

Cons:

- blades spin better on carpet than on wooden floor
- this may sound awkward but the blue elastic bands stand out too much
- troll banner is kind of unstable, the top part falls down a lot (the banner in tower raid is more stable and they should have kept that one)

Overall: Despite some of the flaws, this set is a must buy for any lego castle fan! It is a great set that increases your army with a neat little mine defender. This set deserves a solid 4!

author: NickBrick
title: Thou shall pay troll scum!
review:
This set is pretty nice.The piece count is good when you consider the fact that it come with 3 mini-figs.I also like the color scheme.Why do so many people hate the fantasy era castle sets,I mean the sets were good and these mini-figs are cool too.

                                                Pros.

                                            good pieces

                                             Mini-figs

                                          good playability

                                        drill fuction works well

                                                   cons.

                                            dwarf has no weapon.

author: LobsterWarrior
title: "This might be a good time to RUN!" -Troll
review:
AWESOME AWESOME AWESOME! Few minor glitches though! But AWESOME trolls and sweet dwarf for someone with a low budget. The dwarves are EPIC and not too common! The wheels work GREAT, every time it spins it spins the spikes! (HA, THAT RHYMED) :P. Okay, nice details on the dwarf, LOVE that helmet! But, the little car thing is so not detailed. Well, now on to the pros and cons.

Pros

-Sweet minifigures!

-Nice functions!

-Functions work like a charm!

-Sweeet wheels!

Cons

Not enough details

 

Sorry for the short review, but hey, this is a small set :P.

author: Odeinoichus
title: Defend the Mine Dwarves
review:
Set # 7040 Dwarves' Mine Defender: I bought this on sale I think... It was a great addition to my Castle themed sets and offered some unique mini-figures from the Fantasy Era. I'm kind of sad to see them all vanish off the shelf so quickly, makes it harder to collect the Fantasy Era stuff, going back to Kingdoms is kind of not the same.

 

What you get with this set. Two Trolls, a dwarf and a very bulky looking vehicle - something that looks modern and medieval both at the same time. Building it shouldn't take you too long and there really aren't that many tricky parts to it, though some pieces can get in the way when you're trying to build the saw bladed cowcatcher. (That's what I'm calling it.)

 

The Mini-Figures are great, as is anything from the Fantasy Era Castle theme. The Trolls are pretty ugly looking and they come with some very unique helmets and swords. I was greatly impressed by them and they break up the monotony of my army of knights.

 

The dwarf is made using the shorter leg piece and the beard is also a nice new touch to my Mini-Figures. I particularly like that it's red and not just black or even grey. I think the Set could be improved upon only by adding weapons for all of the figures, the Dwarf should have had an axe to use to defend his position should the Trolls manage to get past the front saw-bladed cowcatcher thing. And what's up with a Troll Warrior carrying only this massive banner into battle?

 

Still it is a worthy addition to your Castle collection and if you can buy more than one it's a sort of cheap alternative for troop building Trolls. (Minus the fact that only one of them gets a sword.) I recommend this set to any fans of Castle who have been on the fence about the Fantasy Era due to its lack of traditional mini-figures. Also I find the new printing used on these Mini-Figures to be rather impressive compared to the older plain blue or black shirts.

author: Sauron_Bauglir
title: An Excellent Starter for Lego Castle fans!
review:
This was my first ever Lego Castle set, and it is a brilliant starter! It is the best of the small Lego Castle sets! 7.5/10.

Pros

  • I love the little Dwarf!
  • The Trolls are brilliant!
  • Excellent army builder.
  • It's a fair battle for once!
  • Second best catapult Lego has ever made (After Knight's Catapult Defense, 7091).
  • Good weapons.

Cons

  • The Dwarf needs a weapon.
  • The build is a bit boring.

A great little set, a must-have for Lego Castle fans! Also, it will fit in brilliantly with Lego Lord of the Rings!
